channel.title: Social network linking pulling inaccurate site title and description
channel.description:
This one has been bugging me for awhile. I have a google+ account for my website and occasionally post changes and such on it. Recently I added a new page to my site. It's not a static page but one that is dynamic and I wanted to announce it on my plus account.
The page I want displayed is: http://cryptospout.com/faucet.php?coin=LTC
However when i post the link in google+ It comes up as:
[img]http://i.imgur.com/bOCmQSf.png[/img]
which would be on this page: http://cryptospout.com/faucet.php?coin=DOGE
The script is pulling the correct meta and title details so I don't see why it would be grabbing the data from the other page. The only thing I can assume is that because i've linked faucet.php before google+ is just lazy and does not requery the data. I would guess that would mean my solution would be to then do a mod rewrite to make a more SEO friendly page url but maybe I am missing something?
[hr]
[b]Problem Solved:[/b] Because I was using properties to define a service in the body the social networking sites were using those over the standard meta data at the head of the page. By providing the header with opengraph properties all social media sites now appear to be pulling the correct information.

item.title: Social network linking pulling inaccurate site title and description
item.dc:creator: @stCky stCky
item.description:
@stCky wrote:

Just went to test and saw your solution, why the hell did I think opengraph meta data was facebook specific

Can confirm I can now see the appropriate icon and title when I share.

Read full topic
item.source: Social network linking pulling inaccurate site title and description

item.title: Social network linking pulling inaccurate site title and description
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

stCky:

Did you end up resolving this?

not yet I went ahead and made my urls more seo friendly: http://cryptospout.com/faucet/LTC.html

but im getting the same result. I’ve come to the assumption that its pickup the “other faucets” section on the bottom of the page.

[hr]

Solution was to implement standard opengraph meta data in the header.

Read full topic

item.title: Social network linking pulling inaccurate site title and description
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Facebook pulls the data every one in a while and not every single time the page is linked, so I cab imagine Google doing similarly. Facebook allows you to force-crawl the page

Read full topic
item.source: Social network linking pulling inaccurate site title and description

item.title: Social network linking pulling inaccurate site title and description
item.dc:creator: @stCky stCky
item.description:
@stCky wrote:

I haven’t used G+ before, so this may not apply.

Facebook however are lazy and ignore GET data so they’d think you’re still just linking faucet.php. They have this tool https://developers.facebook.com/tools/debug/ which I used to use to “refresh” the link and it’d then pull in my new image etc

These links came up trying to find a similar service for G+

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/7985398/is-there-a-google-plus-url-debugger-like-the-one-for-facebook
http://www.google.com/webmasters/tools/richsnippets
https://developers.google.com/+/web/snippet/

Read full topic
item.source: Social network linking pulling inaccurate site title and description

item.title: Social network linking pulling inaccurate site title and description
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

My guess would be that it’s actually just ignoring the GET data and displaying http://cryptospout.com/faucet.php but I’m not sure

Read full topic
